ActionList.name: ActionList
ActionList.description: Used to represent a list of available actions, tasks, or menu options. Typically displays a collection of selectable items that trigger specific actions or functions when selected. Often used in dropdown menus, context menus, or task lists.

Anniversary.name: Anniversary
Anniversary.description: Used to represent anniversaries, celebrations of milestones, or commemorative events. Often used in calendar applications, event planning tools, or HR systems to mark important dates such as work anniversaries or company milestones.

Anonymous.name: Anonymous
Anonymous.description: Used to represent anonymous users, unidentified individuals, or private/incognito modes. Often used in user interfaces to indicate content from unknown sources, anonymous feedback, or when a user's identity is hidden or not available.

Applause.name: Applause
Applause.description: Used to represent appreciation, recognition, or congratulations. Often depicted as clapping hands, this icon is commonly used in social media, feedback systems, or recognition platforms to show approval, celebrate achievements, or express support.

Birthday.name: Birthday
Birthday.description: Used to represent birthdays, celebrations, or special personal occasions. Often depicted with elements like cake, candles, or party items, this icon is commonly used in calendar applications, HR systems, or social platforms to mark and celebrate birthdays.

BrokenImage.name: BrokenImage
BrokenImage.description: Used to represent a failed, corrupted, or unavailable image. Commonly displayed when an image fails to load, is missing, or cannot be displayed due to errors. Helps users understand that visual content should be present but is currently unavailable.

Caution.name: Caution
Caution.description: Used to represent warnings, alerts, or situations requiring careful attention. Often depicted as a triangle with an exclamation mark, this icon signals potential risks, hazards, or important information that users should be aware of before proceeding.

Conversation.name: Conversation
Conversation.description: Used to represent discussions, dialogues, or communication between individuals. Often depicted as speech bubbles, this icon is commonly used in messaging applications, forums, comment sections, or any interface related to interpersonal communication.

Custom.name: Custom
Custom.description: Used to represent customization, personalization, or user-defined content. Often used in interfaces to indicate settings that can be tailored to individual preferences, custom fields, or user-created content that differs from standard options.

DecreasingScore.name: DecreasingScore
DecreasingScore.description: Used to represent declining performance, downward trends, or decreasing metrics. Often depicted as a downward-trending graph or chart, this icon is commonly used in dashboards, analytics, or reporting interfaces to indicate negative performance changes.

DeletedUser.name: DeletedUser
DeletedUser.description: Used to represent a user account that has been removed or deactivated. Often displayed in place of profile pictures or user information for accounts that no longer exist, have been deleted, or have been deactivated in the system.

Department.name: Department
Department.description: Used to represent organizational divisions, teams, or functional units within a company. Often used in organizational charts, HR systems, or company directories to indicate departmental structures such as Marketing, Finance, HR, or Engineering.

Directory.name: Directory
Directory.description: Used to represent a listing, catalog, or organized collection of information. Often used in interfaces for employee directories, contact lists, or any structured collection of entries that users can browse, search, or reference.

Discount.name: Discount
Discount.description: Used to represent price reductions, special offers, or promotional deals. Often depicted as a percentage symbol or price tag, this icon is commonly used in e-commerce, retail applications, or any interface related to sales and promotions.

Email.name: Email
Email.description: Used to represent electronic mail, messaging, or digital communication. Often depicted as an envelope, this icon is commonly used in applications for sending messages, contact forms, or indicating notification preferences.

Feedback.name: Feedback
Feedback.description: Used to represent user opinions, reviews, or evaluations. Often depicted as a comment bubble or form, this icon is commonly used in interfaces for collecting user input, suggestions, ratings, or other forms of assessment and commentary.

GoalIndividual.name: GoalIndividual
GoalIndividual.description: Used to represent personal objectives, targets, or individual performance goals. Often used in HR systems, performance management tools, or personal development applications to indicate individual achievements, targets, or aspirations.

GoalTeam.name: GoalTeam
GoalTeam.description: Used to represent collective objectives, shared targets, or group performance goals. Often used in project management tools, team dashboards, or collaborative platforms to indicate goals that require cooperation and joint effort from multiple team members.

Group.name: Group
Group.description: Used to represent collections of people, teams, or clusters of related items. Often depicted as multiple person silhouettes, this icon is commonly used in interfaces for team management, social platforms, or any context involving collections of users or related entities.

Growth.name: Growth
Growth.description: Used to represent improvement, development, or positive progress over time. Often depicted as an upward trending graph or plant, this icon is commonly used in dashboards, analytics, or personal development contexts to indicate advancement, expansion, or increasing metrics.

Idea.name: Idea
Idea.description: Used to represent thoughts, concepts, inspiration, or innovative thinking. Often depicted as a lightbulb, this icon is commonly used in brainstorming tools, knowledge management systems, or creative platforms to indicate new insights or suggestions.

Info.name: Info
Info.description: Used to represent information, details, or helpful context. Often depicted as the letter "i" in a circle, this icon is commonly used to indicate additional information, tooltips, help text, or explanatory content that provides context.

LikertScale.name: LikertScale
LikertScale.description: Used to represent rating systems or survey questions with a range of responses. Often depicted as a series of points on a line, this icon represents measurement scales used in questionnaires to capture opinions, attitudes, or perceptions across a spectrum of responses.

Location.name: Location
Location.description: Used to represent geographical positions, places, or physical addresses. Often depicted as a map pin or marker, this icon is commonly used in mapping applications, address fields, or any interface related to physical locations or places.

MultipleChoice.name: MultipleChoice
MultipleChoice.description: Used to represent questions or selections with several possible answers. Often depicted as a list with checkboxes or radio buttons, this icon is commonly used in surveys, quizzes, or forms to indicate questions where users can select one or more options from a predefined list.

OneOnOne.name: OneOnOne
OneOnOne.description: Used to represent individual meetings, personal discussions, or direct interactions between two people. Often used in calendar applications, HR systems, or meeting schedulers to indicate private conversations, mentoring sessions, or personal reviews.

OpenRole.name: OpenRole
OpenRole.description: Used to represent vacant positions, job openings, or unfilled roles within an organization. Often used in HR systems, career portals, or organizational charts to indicate positions that are currently available for applications or need to be filled.

OpinionScale.name: OpinionScale
OpinionScale.description: Used to represent measurement of subjective opinions or attitudes on a continuous scale. Often depicted as a slider or spectrum, this icon is commonly used in surveys, feedback forms, or rating systems to collect nuanced responses beyond simple multiple choice options.

Organization.name: Organization
Organization.description: Used to represent companies, institutions, or structured entities. Often depicted as a building or organizational chart, this icon is commonly used to indicate corporate entities, businesses, institutions, or formal organizational structures.

People.name: People
People.description: Used to represent individuals, users, or human resources. Often depicted as multiple person silhouettes, this icon is commonly used in interfaces related to user management, social platforms, HR systems, or any context involving multiple individuals or personnel.

Profile.name: Profile
Profile.description: Used to represent user accounts, personal information, or individual identities. Often depicted as a person silhouette or avatar, this icon is commonly used in interfaces for account settings, user preferences, or personal information pages.

Question.name: Question
Question.description: Used to represent inquiries, help topics, or requests for information. Often depicted as a question mark, this icon is commonly used in interfaces for FAQs, help sections, or to indicate areas where users can ask for assistance.

Reminder.name: Reminder
Reminder.description: Used to represent notifications, alerts, or scheduled prompts. Often depicted as a bell or clock, this icon is commonly used in calendar applications, task managers, or notification systems to indicate upcoming events or tasks that require attention.

Review.name: Review
Review.description: Used to represent evaluation, assessment, or examination processes. Often depicted as a document with checkmarks or stars, this icon is commonly used in feedback systems, performance evaluations, or product review interfaces to indicate assessment activities.

RisingScore.name: RisingScore
RisingScore.description: Used to represent improving performance, upward trends, or increasing metrics. Often depicted as an upward-trending graph or chart, this icon is commonly used in dashboards, analytics, or reporting interfaces to indicate positive performance changes.

Rocket.name: Rocket
Rocket.description: Used to represent launches, startups, or rapid advancement. Often used to symbolize new initiatives, product launches, or accelerated growth. This icon conveys speed, ambition, and upward momentum in business or project contexts.

Script.name: Script
Script.description: Used to represent code, programming, or automated sequences of instructions. Often depicted as a document with code lines, this icon is commonly used in development environments, automation tools, or any interface related to programming or scripted processes.

Settings.name: Settings
Settings.description: Used to represent configuration options, preferences, or system controls. Often depicted as a gear or cog, this icon is commonly used in interfaces to indicate areas where users can customize, configure, or adjust application behavior and appearance.

Sparkles.name: Sparkles
Sparkles.description: Used to represent special features, highlights, or new content. Often depicted as stars or glittering elements, this icon is commonly used to draw attention to premium features, new additions, or special offers that stand out from regular content.

Star.name: Star
Star.description: Used to represent favorites, bookmarks, or important items. Often used in interfaces to allow users to mark content as favorite, rate items, or highlight important information. This icon symbolizes preference, importance, or special status.

Status.name: Status
Status.description: Used to represent the current state, condition, or progress of an item or process. Often depicted as indicators like checkmarks, dots, or progress bars, this icon is commonly used in task management, project tracking, or system monitoring interfaces.

Success.name: Success
Success.description: Used to represent achievement, completion, or positive outcomes. Often depicted as a checkmark or trophy, this icon is commonly used to indicate successful operations, completed tasks, or accomplished goals in user interfaces.

Support.name: Support
Support.description: Used to represent help, assistance, or customer service. Often depicted as a life preserver, headset, or helping hand, this icon is commonly used in interfaces to indicate where users can find help, contact support teams, or access assistance resources.

Template.name: Template
Template.description: Used to represent pre-designed formats, layouts, or patterns that can be reused. Often depicted as a document with sections, this icon is commonly used in content creation tools, document editors, or design applications to indicate reusable structures.

TextAnswer.name: TextAnswer
TextAnswer.description: Used to represent free-form text responses or written feedback. Often depicted as lines of text or a text field, this icon is commonly used in surveys, forms, or feedback systems to indicate areas where users can provide detailed written responses.

Upsell.name: Upsell
Upsell.description: Used to represent promotional offers, upgrades, or premium features. Often depicted as a shopping tag or gift, this icon is commonly used in e-commerce, subscription services, or freemium applications to indicate opportunities to purchase enhanced features or services.

WhosWho.name: WhosWho
WhosWho.description: Used to represent team member identification, organizational directories, or employee recognition activities. Often used in HR systems, company intranets, or team-building applications to help identify and connect team members.
